sentences.sentence: U.S. President Joe Biden arriving in the United Kingdom late on Sunday night,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: ahead of a NATO summit in Lithuania and a visit to Finland.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: He's due to hold talks with Britain's Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and to meet with King Charles for the first time since he became king.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The stop-off is a diplomatic gesture of goodwill, but it comes as Biden announced he was sending controversial cluster bombs to Ukraine several NATO members opposed the use of the munitions and Prime Minister Sunak has already made Britain's position clear well the UK is signatory to a convention which prohibits the production or use of cluster munitions and discourages their use we will continue to do our part to support Ukraine against Russia's illegal and unprovoked invasion. We've done that by providing heavy battle tanks and most recently long range weapons. And hopefully all countries can continue to support Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: During his stay in the UK, Biden is also expected to raise his concerns over post-Brexit challenges to the peace process in Northern Ireland.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But when he moves on to Lithuania, he's likely to be challenged over the decision to provide Ukraine with clustered munitions, which cause indiscriminate civilian casualties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Also on the NATO agenda is Ukraine's bid for membership.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: membership. The presidents of Ukraine and Poland together marked the anniversary of one of World War II's bloodiest episodes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Volhynia massacre took place between 1943 and 1945 during the Second World War, which saw both nations lose tens of thousands of lives.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Warsaw's support is more important than ever for Kyiv ahead of this week's NATO summit, where Ukraine is hoping for decisions that will hasten its goals of membership in the alliance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Returning back to Ukraine, he brought back with him five commanders, forced to live in Turkey under the terms of a prisoner exchange last year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It's Romania's turn to train Ukrainian pilots on F-16 fighter jets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: For months, Ukraine has been asking for this American-made aircraft to help fight off the Russian invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And on May 19th, after numerous refusals, U.S. President Joe Biden gave the go ahead. Kiev is finding it difficult to assert itself in the air, and the F-16 would enable it to regain control of the sky and provide backup for troops.

We have not held a physical summit for quite a long time, almost three years now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: show incumbent Shavkat MedelzeyoyYuryev winning with 87.1% of the vote. He was widely expected to win a third term after calling a snap election, following a constitutional referendum earlier this year which paved the way for him to serve two more presidential terms. It also increased the mandate from five to seven years. The 65-year-old leader has opened up the tightly controlled former Soviet republic to foreign investment and tourism. But there's still little political freedom.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A wave of sweltering temperatures is engulfing much of Europe, sending many dashing for the

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: shade or seeking other ways to cool down. In Lyon in south-east France the mercury hit a blistering 38 degrees Celsius at the weekend. While Meteo France says this is a non-exceptional heatwave for the season, it has warned the high temperatures will continue. The elderly and vulnerable people have been urged to stay vigilant. Germany also recorded temperatures of 38 degrees. Authorities across the country and in Poland say that while lakes and rivers might look enticing, bathers need 38 Grad. Die Arten in der Stadt und in Polen sagen, dass, während Flächen und Flächen enttäuschend sehen, die Bäder sich an den Kühlwasser-Schock erinnern.
